isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase - Remove - Remove Rear PTO Housing Assembly (If Equipped)

svcproc.title: Remove Rear PTO Housing Assembly (If Equipped)

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, support back end of engine when servicing rear PTO assembly.

note.para: Rear oil seal can be serviced in chassis. This procedure can be performed as part of engine overhaul or separately, when required.
Rear oil seal is in rear PTO housing assembly. This rear seal is different than engine rear oil seal.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Flywheel or Flexplate
svcsubproc.para: See "Remove Flywheel" in this section. Removal of flexplate is similar.

note.para: For applications using automatic transmissions, take note of position and orientation of the flexplate, spacers, and reinforcing ring.

step1.para: Install 5/8 in course thread lifting eye in tapped hole located on top of rear PTO housing. Use an appropriate lifting device to support rear PTO housing.
Loosen lubrication supply tube nuts from crankcase to rear PTO housing. Remove supply tube.
Loosen and remove lubrication supply tube elbow on rear PTO housing.
Remove four pipe plugs from rear PTO housing. Save pipe plugs for installation.
Remove special hex nut inside rear PTO housing (under PTO unit drive center line upper pipe plug). Do not let special nut fall inside housing.
Remove three PTO housing mounting bolts after pipe plugs have been removed.
Install four pipe plugs back in rear PTO housing.
Remove remaining four PTO housing mounting bolts.
Place rags or suitable container under rear PTO housing assembly. Dispose of rags, containers, and oil according to local regulations.

note.para: Approximately one quart of oil remains in housing sump area.
Be sure to support crank gear when removing PTO housing. If crank gear is not supported, it may fall in PTO housing.

step1.para: Pull rear PTO housing assembly straight back, away from crankcase.
Remove one hollow dowel pin and four O-rings from PTO housing.
Lay rear PTO housing assembly face down on engine mounting surface side. Remove dowel guide pins.

note.para: Some additional oil may drain from PTO housing as it is laid flat.

svcsubproc.title: Remove PTO Housing Rear Oil Sleeve
svcsubproc.para: Remove the pose seal and rear oil seal. See " Remove Rear Oil Seal " in this section.

svcsubproc.title: Remove PTO Housing Rear Oil Seal Carrier

note.para: The rear oil seal is in the rear PTO housing assembly. See appropriate Chassis Service Manual for service procedures.
The rear oil seal carrier can not be removed until four bolts mounted through oil pan and in bottom of rear oil seal carrier are removed. See "Remove Oil Pan" in this section.

step1.para: Remove six bolts securing rear carrier to crankcase. Remove carrier.
Remove rear oil seal carrier. Remove rear oil seal from carrier. Hammer may be used to remove seal from carrier. Discard oil seal.
Remove and discard rear oil seal carrier gasket.

svcsubproc.title: Remove PTO Housing Rear Wear Sleeve
svcsubproc.para: Remove rear wear sleeve. See "Remove Rear Wear Sleeve" in this section.
